output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in linear algebra, equipping you with the essential tools and techniques for various applications in mathematics, science, and engineering.
output.introduction: Welcome to Linear Algebra! This course will cover fundamental concepts such as vectors, matrices, linear transformations, and eigenvalues. Designed for intermediate learners, we will delve into both the theoretical underpinnings and practical applications of these concepts.

chapters.description: Introduction to vectors, vector spaces, subspaces, linear combinations, and span. Examples of vector spaces.
Linear independence, basis, dimension of a vector space, and coordinates with respect to a basis.
Matrix addition, scalar multiplication, matrix multiplication, transpose, and inverse of a matrix.
Identity matrix, diagonal matrix, triangular matrices, symmetric matrices, and skew-symmetric matrices.
Definition of linear transformations, examples, kernel and range of a linear transformation.
Matrix representation of a linear transformation, change of basis, and similarity transformations.
Definition of eigenvalues and eigenvectors, characteristic polynomial, and eigenspaces.
Diagonalization of matrices, applications of diagonalization, and Cayley-Hamilton theorem.
